alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 5:10AM PST until December 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * CHANGES...Added Winter Storm Watch for next storm late Wednesday into Thursday. Updated additional snow totals for current warning. * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, with localized amounts up to 6 inches west of highway 395. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, except 6 to 14 inches west of Highway 395 possible late Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. Winds could gust up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact this morning`s commute. The next storm will likely affect the Wednesday afternoon and especially the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
